definition: background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: "Abe of the Potentilla cryptottaeniae" the secondary roles also similarly have the component.
sentences.chinese: 《狼牙之阿布》的班底也同樣有分量。

sentences.english: The United squad is very large and there is no major significance in adding another name.
sentences.chinese: 曼聯班底已經非常龐大，再增加一人不會天翻地覆。

sentences.english: When Shah Naqshband died he was buried in his garden as he requested.
sentences.chinese: 篩海乃格士班底要求他去世後要葬在他的花園裏。

definition: New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)

to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
newcomer/fresh talent/newlywed, esp. new bride/bride and groom
to play a leading role/to bear a heavy responsibility
direct line of descent/under one's personal command/school or faction passing on faithfully one's doctrine
